text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 7.14.2, Employee Plans EDS User Manual, Data Entry.

Added Internal Controls . Amended and renamed IRM 7.14.2.1,, Program, Scope and Objectives. Added IRM 7.14.2.1.1, Background, IRM 7.14.2.1.2, Authority, IRM 7.14.2.1.3, Responsibilities and IRM 7.14.2.1.4, Acronyms.
Material contained in prior IRM 7.14.2.1, Overview, is now contained in IRM 7.14.2.1.1, Background.
EFFECT ON OTHER DOCUMENTS
This supersedes IRM 7.14.2 dated September 1, 2015.
Tax Exempt and Government Entities Employee Plans
Table of Contents
EDS Main Menu
Scope and (

) Purpose: This IRM lists instructions on the EDS Data Transcription System (DTS) to EP specialists, reviewers, managers and other authorized EDS users to allow them to manually establish DL applications on EDS and reprint Form
, Transmittal Sheets . (
) Audience: Employee Plans (EP) Determinations and Quality Assurance (QA) staff (
) Policy Owner: Director, EP (
) Program Owner: EP (

) Program Goals: The goal of EP Determinations is to ensure that plans are compliance with the tax laws by reviewing applications for Determination Letters (DL) and opinion letters, and to protect the public interest by applying the tax law with integrity and fairness to all. (

) The Tax Exempt Determination System (TEDS) is the primary system Employee Plans (EP) uses to process Determination Letter (DL) applications. Generally, EP will establish and work DL applications in TEDS but create the ﬁnal DL in the EP/EO Determination System (EDS). However, in rare circum- stances, an application will not be established in TEDS at all and will be established and processed only in EDS. Entry
page
Note: Do not establish an application on EDS without managerial approval.
) EDS is divided into six sub-sections. (
) Data Transcription System (DTS) generates EP Applications and Transmittal sheets. (

) EDS is a menu-driven system. You can choose functions from a list of available options. When you select a valid option, it will display an input or another submenu. When you complete an option, the higher level displayed so you may select another option or exit EDS. (
) Delegation Order
, IRM
, states the Director, Employee Plans authority to issue favorable DLs on the qualiﬁed status of: a. Pension, proﬁt-sharing, stock bonus, annuity, and employee stock ownership plans under IRC
, IRC
(a), IRC
, IRC
). b. The status for exemption of any related trusts or custodial accounts under IRC
) Find a complete list of delegation orders governing EP Rulings and Agree- ments at http://www.irs.gov/uac/Delegation-Orders-by-Process
) See IRM
, Exhibit
for a complete list of the major EP revenue cedures currently in effect. (
) The Director, EP supervises and is responsible for: a. EP Rulings and Agreements b. EP Examination functions c. EP Program Management Staff
Delegation Order 7-1, IRM 1.2.2.8.1, states the Director, Employee Plans has authority to issue favorable DLs on the qualiﬁed status of:
7.14 Employee Plans EDS User Manual
The Director, EP Examination, supervises and is responsible for:

Acronym Deﬁnition DCSC Determination Centralized site in Cincinnati DL Determination Letter DLN Document Locator Number DTS Data Transcription System EP Employee Plans EDS EP/EO Determination System POA Power of Attorney QA Quality Assurance TEDS Tax Exempt Determination System TE/GE Tax Exempt/Government Entities
) The main input documents for EDS and TEDS are the EP application forms. (
) The EP application forms are as follows: • Form
, Application for Determination for Employee Beneﬁt Plan • Form
, Application for Determination for Adopter of Modiﬁed Volume Submitter Plans • Form
, Application for Determination for Terminating Plans • Form
, Application for Determination of Employee Stock Ownership Plan • Form
, Application for Group or Pooled Trust Ruling (

) In most circumstances, the IRS establishes cases using these procedures: a. The Tax Exempt and Government Entities (TE/GE) Deposit Unit processes the user fee on Letter Information Network User Fee System (LINUS) using the procedures in IRM
, TE/GE Processing, Processing Employee Plan and Exempt Organization Determination Ap- plications and User Fees. b. The application is then established on TEDS using the procedures in
The user fee information is then uploaded from LINUS to TEDS. c. All of the information from TEDS is then uploaded to EDS.
The main input documents for EDS and TEDS are the EP application forms.
The EP application forms are as follows: • Form
, Application for Determination for Employee Beneﬁt Plan • Form
, Application for Determination for Adopter of Modiﬁed Volume Submitter Plans • Form
, Application for Determination for Terminating Plans • Form

, Application for Group or Pooled Trust Ruling
In most circumstances, the IRS establishes cases using these procedures:
a. The Tax Exempt and Government Entities (TE/GE) Deposit Unit processes the user fee on Letter Information Network User Fee System (LINUS) using the procedures in IRM
, TE/GE Processing, Processing Employee Plan and Exempt Organization Determination Ap- plications and User Fees. b. The application is then established on TEDS using the procedures in IRM
The user fee information is then uploaded from LINUS to TEDS. c. All of the information from TEDS is then uploaded to EDS.
) After logging into EDS, the system displays the EDS main menu screen. See Exhibit
) Select Option
to enter into DTS. See Exhibit

a. If application data is found in the hold (scanned) ﬁle, the data will be displayed in each of the appropriate ﬁelds. b. Verify the data for accuracy; ﬁll in any required blank ﬁelds. c. If no application data is found in the hold ﬁle, a blank screen will be displayed and you must enter the data in each input ﬁeld. (

) Verify/enter response to the screen prompts in the input ﬁelds. a. Find the answers to the questions on the application form. b. Use the arrow and/or tab keys to skip over ﬁelds. c. Use the same keys to position the cursor in the next input ﬁeld when an input ﬁeld in not completely ﬁlled. d. Press F
after you veriﬁed or entered all the required ﬁelds. (

) EDS performs edits and consistency checks to ensure that the data veriﬁed/ entered is correct. a. If there is an input error, the screen will display the error message and the cursor will be on the ﬁeld in error. Once you have corrected all of data, press F
b. If there are no input errors, press F
) Complete the Power of Attorney (POA) screen after you have entered all of application data. Press F

to accept the POA data. The left bottom of the screen will display a message “Case Complete” and display the case number. Record this case number on the EP Determinations Input Sheet located on front of the case ﬁle. If a duplicate record is found, the Duplicate Establishment screen will be displayed. If there is no duplicate record, the Print Format/ Selection Screen will be displayed. (

) To reprint a transmittal sheet, the case must be established and assigned an EDS Case Number. If the case number is unknown, use the Query/Update Master File option of the Inventory Control Subsystem (ICS) to obtain the case number. See IRM
, Employee Plans EDS User Manual, Inventory Control Subsystem (ICS). (
) The Reprint Transmittal Sheet screen will allow you to enter up to
case numbers per screen. After you have entered all case numbers, press F
to select a printer. The program will display a blank screen continuously to print maximum of
transmittal sheets per blank screen until you press F
to exit. (
) See Exhibit
, Reprint Transmittal Sheet Screen for further instructions.
See Exhibit 7.14.2-11, Reprint Transmittal Sheet Screen for further instructions.

(2) Enter one of the valid option numbers (1 or 2). Option 3 is no longer valid. Note: When option 2 is selected, the Reprint Transmittal Sheet screen is shown. See Exhibit 7.14.2-11.
(3) Use Option 1 to establish applications. When Option 1 is selected, enter the Document Locator Number (DLN) or Incomplete Case Number and press F1.
Note: The Incomplete Case Number option was primarily used prior to determination work centralizing in the EP Determination Centralized Site in Cincinnati (EP-DCSC).
a. When you enter a case number, the system checks to see whether the case number exists. (Note: Incomplete Letter records are removed from the system after
days.) b. If the DLN exists, the data previously entered on LINUS for the Employer Identiﬁcation Number (EIN), Name, Address, and User Fee is displayed on the EP Initial Screen. See Exhibit
c. If the DLN does not exist, a blank EP Initial Screen is displayed. See Exhibit

When you enter a case number, the system checks to see whether the case number exists. (Note: Incomplete Letter records are removed from the system after 180 days.) If the DLN exists, the data previously entered on LINUS for the Employer Identiﬁcation Number (EIN), Name, Address, and User Fee is displayed on the EP Initial Screen. See Exhibit 7.14.2-3. If the DLN does not exist, a blank EP Initial Screen is displayed. See Exhibit 7.14.2-3.

The DLN is a unique
digit number assigned to the case in the Campus. You may enter it to query for a speciﬁc case.
Document Locator Number (DLN)
The 9 digit Case Number.

(1) The EP Initial screen below is displayed when you select option 1 from the DTS Main Menu as described in Exhibit 7.14.2-2, Data Transcription System . Note: TEDS is the primary system for processing DL applications. Most applications will be es- tablished on TEDS and only the ﬁnal DL will be created on EDS. Do not establish an application using these procedures without managerial approval.
(2) If the DLN entered in the DTS screen is valid, the data previously entered on LINUS for the EIN, Name, Address, and User Fee will be displayed.
(3) If the DLN entered in the DTS screen was not valid, the screen will be blank and you must enter the application manually.

The EIN must be entered twice to prevent accidental transposition of numbers. EIN is a required entry. If the EIN is not available for requests such as a group or pooled trust, enter 99-9999999. A “dummy” EIN will be generated and the request will be processed.
Must be entered in the valid date format. Must be no greater than the current system date. See instructions in IRM 7.13.3, Screening, Controlling and Case Closing .

(1) The following screen is displayed when you select option (2) from the DTS Main Menu (Exhibit 7.14.2-2). You can also access it using the ICS Main Menu option 5 (IRM 7.14.5). You can print a transmittal sheet (Form 8326, EDS EP/EO Case Transmittal ) after the case has been transcribed. It is usually attached it to the front of the case. You can request up to 20 transmittal sheets at a time. Reprint Transmittal Sheet veriﬁes each Case Number at a time to see if it exists on EDS. Messages will be displayed when a Case Number cannot be found.
EDS-CSS-652 REPRINT TRANSMITTAL SHEET Enter Case Number(s): Hit F1:Execute F10:Exit
(4) When there are no input errors and:

All case numbers are found on EDS, a blank Reprint Transmittal screen will be displayed to enter up to 20 case numbers. When you ﬁnish printing the transmittals, continue at (6) below. A case number is not found. A “record not found” message will be displayed, continue at (5) below.

(6) After pressing F1 a blank screen will be displayed with a message to press F5 to process and print the transmittals requested. Continue at (3) above if you have additional case numbers to enter. If you do not have more case numbers to enter, press F5. The Printer Format/Selection screen (Exhibit 7.14.2-10) is displayed.
DESCRIPTION
Must be numeric. Must be a case number in the EDS system.
